definition: lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: He thinks nothing of throwing away a thousand dollars at the gambling house.
sentences.chinese: 他在赌场里一掷千金满不在乎。

sentences.english: They may be business-minded, but they can also fritter money away!
sentences.chinese: 他们或许很有生意头脑，但也很容易一掷千金。

sentences.english: Arsene Wenger insists he could spend millions like Manchester City counterpart Roberto Mancini.
sentences.chinese: 温格坚称他也可以像曼城主教练曼奇尼一样一掷千金。
